title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve ½ cup of pasta water before draining
Prepare the sauce: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan, and black pepper.
Cook the pancetta: Heat olive oil in a pan, fry pancetta (or bacon) until crispy. Add garlic for extra flavor, then remove from heat.
Combine everything: Toss hot spaghetti into the pan with pancetta. Remove from heat and quickly mix in the egg mixture, stirring fast so the heat thickens the sauce without scrambling the eggs.
Adjust consistency: Add reserved pasta water gradually if needed for a creamy sauce.
Serve hot, topped with extra Parmesan and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 500g chicken breast or thighs, cut into chunks
½ cup heavy cream (or coconut milk)
instructions: Marinate the chicken: Mix all marinade ingredients and coat chicken.
Let sit for at least 30 minutes (or overnight for best results).
Grill or cook chicken: Sear the marinated chicken in a hot pan or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 15-20 minutes. Set aside.
Make the sauce: In a pan, heat butter/oil, sauté onions until soft. Add garlic, ginger, and spices, cooking until fragrant.
Add tomatoes & simmer: Pour in crushed tomatoes, simmer for 10 minutes. Blend for a smoother texture (optional).
Finish with cream: Stir in cream, add the grilled chicken, and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan, garnished with fresh cilantro.

title: Jollof Rice
summary: A West African dish of rice cooked in a tomato based sauce, served with fried ripe plantains and a protein of choice.
instructions: Parboil the rice: Wash and partially cook the rice. Drain and set aside.
Make the tomato sauce: Heat oil, sauté chopped onions until soft. Add garlic, tomato paste, and blended tomato mixture. Cook for 10-15 minutes until thickened.
Add seasonings & broth: Stir in thyme, curry, paprika, seasoning cube, and bay leaf. Pour in broth/water.
Cook the rice: Add parboiled rice, stir well, cover with foil and a lid. Cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Fluff and serve: Once rice is cooked and absorbed the sauce, remove bay leaf, fluff with a fork, and serve with fried plantains or grilled chicken.

title: Nigerian Egg Sauce
summary: A saucy egg and tomato scramble often served with rice or fried or boiled yams, potatoes or plantains
instructions: Beat the eggs: In a bowl, whisk the eggs with a pinch of salt.
Sauté veggies: Heat oil in a pan, fry onions until translucent. Add tomatoes, pepper, and seasoning. Cook for 5-7 minutes until slightly thickened.
Cook the eggs: Reduce heat, pour in beaten eggs. Let sit for a few seconds, then scramble gently until fully cooked.
Serve hot with boiled yam, plantains, or bread.
